New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 10 月 23 日，星期三 22:11:45 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Gisborne’s Sunrise Foundation to mark 10 years with ‘Sunrise Week’ in November https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-sunrise-foundation-to-mark-10-years-with-sunrise-week-in-november/FPJO25OFMRBM7BJ2QBHTLN6RDY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisbornes-sunrise-foundation-to-mark-10-years-with-sunrise-week-in-november/FPJO25OFMRBM7BJ2QBHTLN6RDY/ Variety of 'orange' events planned; community encouraged to get involved. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 22:09:24 +0000 The Sunrise Foundation team had a morning tea with staff from BDO this week, where their office is located, to talk about Sunrise Week with them. They are all feeling orange and enthused in the build-up to the foundation's Sunrise Week.
Public sector cuts: $80m spent on redundancies since Govt took office https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-80m-spent-on-redundancies-since-govt-took-office/CKCB47ZFINHRHE2W242N322MFE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/public-sector-cuts-80m-spent-on-redundancies-since-govt-took-office/CKCB47ZFINHRHE2W242N322MFE/ Ministries and agencies have also carried out 161 change processes or restructures. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 22:07:35 +0000 Finance Minister and Minister for the Public Service Nicola Willis said ministries and agencies were paying out redundancies within smaller budgets. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Blindfolded marathon for mental health https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sunlive/news/blindfolded-marathon-for-mental-health/4IJD46HSJJBFNFNHBXSPJLIKOE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/sunlive/news/blindfolded-marathon-for-mental-health/4IJD46HSJJBFNFNHBXSPJLIKOE/ Justin Weston is set to run the Barfoot & Thompson Auckland Marathon. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 22:00:14 +0000 The Auckland Marathon where Justin Weston will compete on Sunday. Photo / supplied
Onehunga bus attack live updates: Police give update after passenger fatally stabbed on Auckland bus https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/onehunga-bus-attack-live-updates-police-give-update-after-passenger-fatally-stabbed-on-auckland-bus/W5YSEON44NCZPNCJIFKDQZZXZU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/onehunga-bus-attack-live-updates-police-give-update-after-passenger-fatally-stabbed-on-auckland-bus/W5YSEON44NCZPNCJIFKDQZZXZU/ Rachel MaherPolice will front media with an update around 10.30am. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:59:11 +0000 Police have released an image of Kael Leona in relation to a stabbing on a bus in Onehunga. He was last seen in the area wearing a dark jumper with shoes, he had a green t-shirt on his head and was carrying a black pack. The public were advised not to approach the man. Photo Composite: NZME/NZ Police
Mysterious cat shavings alarm Palmerston North pet owners, SPCA investigates https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/mysterious-cat-shavings-alarm-palmerston-north-pet-owners-spca-investigates/PLMRVABB75H53IVG6S6ONXYWHM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/manawatu-guardian/news/mysterious-cat-shavings-alarm-palmerston-north-pet-owners-spca-investigates/PLMRVABB75H53IVG6S6ONXYWHM/ Grace OdlumA phantom cat barber is on the loose in Palmerston North. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:56:06 +0000 Bosco came home trimmed all over, with his mane cut.
Shearing and woolhandling: New Zealand chases elusive clean sweep in Australia https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/shearing-and-woolhandling-new-zealand-chases-elusive-clean-sweep-in-australia/UJ5QK3RXFVCORBP3MBERMU4LRU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/shearing-and-woolhandling-new-zealand-chases-elusive-clean-sweep-in-australia/UJ5QK3RXFVCORBP3MBERMU4LRU/ Doug LaingNZ chasing transtasman machine shearing, blades shearing, and woolhandling tests. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:53:11 +0000 Southland shearer Leon Samuels is in the New Zealand transtasman team, now in Katanning, Western Australia, for machine shearing, blade shearing and woolhandling tests over the weekend. Photo / Pete Nikolaison
Theodore’s passion for Wa165 shines at Gisborne City Vintage Rail https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/theodores-passion-for-wa165-shines-at-gisborne-city-vintage-rail/YD24D5XXP5DFFFRDDHMSDM7KKI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/theodores-passion-for-wa165-shines-at-gisborne-city-vintage-rail/YD24D5XXP5DFFFRDDHMSDM7KKI/ Wynsley WrigleyHis love for Wa165 began in Māhia; he now drives steam locomotives nationwide Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:36:32 +0000 Theodore Drager's passion for Wa165 began as a youth, volunteering with Gisborne Vintage Rail from Hawke's Bay. These days he fires up Wa165 and drives it.
One of the last SH2 south recovery jobs starts https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/one-of-the-last-sh2-south-recovery-jobs-starts/DBRSEAGQTVBVDPUVGZP5DI7BUQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/one-of-the-last-sh2-south-recovery-jobs-starts/DBRSEAGQTVBVDPUVGZP5DI7BUQ/ Work has started on one of the last recovery projects on SH2 south. Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:35:05 +0000 Trec crews have been working on a large retaining wall job at the White Pine underslip on SH2 south between Wairoa and Napier since March this year and the job is expected to be finished before Christmas.
Longline classic, First Light Food & Wine and Gizzy monthly market in Tairāwhiti this weekend https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/longline-classic-first-light-food-wine-and-gizzy-monthly-market-in-tairawiti-this-weekend/ZYES3LCVZRCYXM7JYOSCZIQKUU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/longline-classic-first-light-food-wine-and-gizzy-monthly-market-in-tairawiti-this-weekend/ZYES3LCVZRCYXM7JYOSCZIQKUU/ Kim ParkinsonWhat’s on in Tairāwhitii: Longline classic, First Light Food & Wine and Wa165 excursion Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:19:03 +0000 TW Wines will host this year's First Light Food & Wine Festival in Gisborne this Labour weekend.
Artist Chrissy Morrell showcases diverse works in upcoming exhibition https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/artist-chrissy-morrell-showcases-diverse-works-in-upcoming-exhibition/BNAFSSLUJVGM5MMMSFXTBBGEKY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/artist-chrissy-morrell-showcases-diverse-works-in-upcoming-exhibition/BNAFSSLUJVGM5MMMSFXTBBGEKY/ Kim ParkinsonFrom landscapes to abstracts: Morrell's artistic evolution on display Wed, 23 Oct 2024 21:10:02 +0000 Gisborne artist Chrissy Morrell is to have an exhibition at her Wainui home from this Saturday.
